Define Documentation

#define NRS_ORR_OBJ_NAME_MAX   (sizeof("nrs_orr_reg_") + 3)

The largest base string for unique hash/slab object names is "nrs_orr_reg_", so 13 characters.

We add 3 to this to be used for the CPT id number, so this _should_ be more than enough for the maximum number of CPTs on any system. If it does happen that this statement is incorrect, nrs_orr_genobjname() will inevitably yield a non-unique name and cause kmem_cache_create() to complain (on Linux), so the erroneous situation will hopefully not go unnoticed.

Definition at line 102 of file lustre_nrs_orr.h.
